metadata.title: Friday, 13th October, 2023
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) when the construction of Chimwemwe Level I Hospital in Chimwemwe Parliamentary Constituency will be completed;
(b) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is; and
(c) when the Hospital will become operational.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to create additional collection points for agricultural inputs under the Farmer Input Support Programme in Namwala District; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a health centre in Kabinga Chiefdom, which is densely populated, in Kanchibiya District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) if there are no such plans, why.

(a) why farmers who paid for farming inputs under the Enhanced Smallholder Agribusiness Promotion Programme (E-SAPP) for the 2021/2022 farming season in the following areas in Chasefu Parliamentary Constituency, did not receive the inputs:
(i) Phikamalaza; (ii) Malaudula; and (iii) Emusa; and
(b) what measures are being taken to ensure that the farmers receive their inputs.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs and Internal Security
parts: (a) when the newly constructed Sakanya Border Post in Ndola District will be opened to the public; and

(b) whether the Zambian Government has any plans to negotiate with the Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo to reduce the fees charged at the Border. 104. Mr E Tembo (Feira) - to ask theMinister of Green Economy and Environment:
(a) why the Government consented to a proposal by Bi-Carbon Partners (BCP), a private company, to acquire land in a forest in Luangwa District for a period of 30 years;
(b) what benefits will accrue to the country through the envisaged partnership at the following levels:
(i) local; and (ii) national;
(c) how much money BCP, as an agent, was getting paid for facilitating the acquisition of the forest;
(d) whether the portion of the forest allocated was bigger than what was initially negotiated for, with the chiefs; and
(e) if so, why.
(a) when the Government will reopen the following Local Courts in Milenge Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Itemba; and (ii) Sokontwe; and
(b) why the courts were closed. ORDER OF THE DAY 1. Supply - Motion (29th September) - Resumption of Debate: (Mr Mabeta, MP) ___________________________
